title: Response
description: Response describes the organization's response to the incident, including technical and behavioral controls, investigation, and legal response. An incident may have only one response entity. A response may have only one legal response entity.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "response--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

technical_controls.description: Controls put in place to limit or monitor the insider's access to devices, data, or the network or to limit or monitor network or device access for the user population more generally

behavioral_controls.description: Controls put in place to limit, monitor, or correct the insider's behavior within the organization

investigated_by.description: The organization(s) or entity(s) that investigated the incident

investigation_events.description: Specific events that happened during the course of the investigation into the incident

comment.description: Clarifying comments or additional details about the organization's response

oneOf.title: Access to Technical System(s) Restricted
oneOf.description: Insider's access to the organization's technical systems is restricted in any capacity (e.g., the organization declares that insider could only log onto system if another employee is present)

oneOf.title: Access to Technical System(s) Terminated
oneOf.description: Insider's access to the organization's technical systems is completely terminated (e.g., the insider's account is deleted upon termination from the company)

oneOf.title: Counseling
oneOf.description: Insider is sent to counseling of any kind as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Demoted
oneOf.description: Insider is demoted (.g., reduced their rank, title, or responsbilities)

oneOf.title: Passed Over For Promotion
oneOf.description: Organization chooses to promote someone other than the insider as a result of the insider's actions

oneOf.title: Poor Performance Review
oneOf.description: Insider receives a review of their work performance which is deemed below average

oneOf.title: Put on Paid/Unpaid Leave
oneOf.description: Insider is put on temporary leave from a job assignment, with or without pay and benefits

oneOf.title: Referred to Employee Assistance Program
oneOf.description: Insider is referred to the EAP as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Reported to HR
oneOf.description: Insider is reported to Human Resources as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Suspended
oneOf.description: Insider is suspended (definitely or indefinitely) and not allowed to conduct normal work for the organization

oneOf.title: Terminated
oneOf.description: Insider is terminated, or fired, from the organization

oneOf.title: Transferred
oneOf.description: Insider is transferred to another company location as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Verbal Reprimand
oneOf.description: Insider receives a verbal reprimand from their supervisor as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Written Reprimand
oneOf.description: Insider receives a written reprimand from their supervisor as a result of their actions

oneOf.title: Evidence Found
oneOf.description: Evidence relevant to the incident is found (e.g., fellow employee found a USB drive left in the insider's computer that had sensitive company files downloaded on to it)

oneOf.title: Insider Admits to Activity in Interview
oneOf.description: Insider admits to involvement in insider incident while being interviewed by investigators about the incident (or related activity)

oneOf.title: Insider's Residence/Workplace Searched
oneOf.description: Investigators search the insider's home or workplace for evidence related to the incident

oneOf.title: Case Opened Internally
oneOf.description: The victim organization open a case to investigate the insider

oneOf.title: Case Opened with Law Enforcement
oneOf.description: Law enforcement opened a case to investigate the insider

oneOf.title: Insider Interviewed
oneOf.description: Insider is interviewed about the incident by investigators

oneOf.title: Incident Response Team
oneOf.description: Incident Response Team (IRT), whether internal to the organization or provided by an external contract

oneOf.title: Internal Investigators
oneOf.description: Other investigators internal to the victim organization

oneOf.title: Law Enforcement - Federal
oneOf.description: Federal law enforcement entity such as the FBI or USSS

oneOf.title: Law Enforcement - Government Agency
oneOf.description: Law enforcement belonging to a government agency such as DHS, USPS, or the IRS

oneOf.title: Law Enforcement - Local/State
oneOf.description: State or local law enforcement entity

oneOf.title: Law Enforcement - Military/DoD
oneOf.description: Law enforcement belonging to the military or Department of Defense such as military police or NCIS

oneOf.title: Management
oneOf.description: Management internal to the organization

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other investigator not listed in this vocabulary
